00020    /*
00021    * Constructor.
00022    */
00023    CellList::CellList()
00024    {
00025       for (int i = 0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00026          invCellWidths_[i] = 0.0;
00027          numCells_[i] = 0;
00028          minCells_[i] = 0;
00029          maxCells_[i] = 0;
00030          minDel_[i] = 0;
00031          maxDel_[i] = 0;
00032       }
00033       YZCells_ = 0;
00034       totCells_ = 0;
00035    }
00036 
00037    /*
00038    * Destructor. 
00039    */
00040    CellList::~CellList()
00041    {}
00042 
00043    /*
00044    * Resets all Cell and CellTag objects to empty state.
00045    */
00046    void CellList::clear()
00047    {
00048       int i;
00049 
00050       // Clear all Cell objects
00051       if (cells_.capacity() > 0) {
00052          for (i=0; i < cells_.capacity(); ++i) {
00053             cells_[i].clear();
00054          }
00055       }
00056 
00057       // Clear all CellTag objects
00058       if (cellTags_.capacity() > 0) {
00059          for (i = 0; i < cellTags_.capacity(); ++i) {
00060             cellTags_[i].clear();
00061          }
00062       }
00063 
00064    }
00065 
00066    /*
00067    * Set number of cells and width for one axis (x,y, or z)
00068    */
00069    void 
00070    CellList::setCellsAxis(int axis, double cutoff)
00071    {
00072       numCells_[axis] = (int)(lengths_[axis]/cutoff);
00073       if (numCells_[axis] < 1) {
00074          numCells_[axis] = 1;
00075       }
00076       if (UTIL_ORTHOGONAL) {
00077          invCellWidths_[axis] = ((double)numCells_[axis])/lengths_[axis];
00078       } else {
00079          invCellWidths_[axis] = (double)numCells_[axis];
00080       }
00081 
00082       minCells_[axis]  = 0;
00083       maxCells_[axis]  = numCells_[axis]-1;
00084 
00085       if (numCells_[axis] > 2) {
00086          minDel_[axis] = -1;
00087          maxDel_[axis] =  1;
00088       } else if (numCells_[axis] == 2) {
00089          minDel_[axis] = -1;
00090          maxDel_[axis] =  0;
00091       } else if (numCells_[axis] == 1) {
00092          minDel_[axis] =  0;
00093          maxDel_[axis] =  0;
00094       }
00095    }
00096 
00097    /*
00098    * Allocate cells_ and cellTags_ arrays.
00099    */
00100    void 
00101    CellList::allocate(
00102              int atomCapacity, const Boundary &boundary, double cutoff)
00103    {
00104 
00105       // Precondition on parameters
00106       if (atomCapacity <= 0) UTIL_THROW("atomCapacity must be > 0");
00107       if (cutoff       <= 0) UTIL_THROW("cutoff must be > 0");
00108 
00109       // Allocate an array of CellTag objects, indexed by atom Ids.
00110       cellTags_.allocate(atomCapacity);
00111       
00112       // Allocate an Array of Cell objects
00113       makeGrid(boundary, cutoff);
00114       cells_.allocate(totCells_);
00115       clear();
00116       
00117    }
00118 
00119    /*
00120    * Create a grid of cells.
00121    */
00122    void CellList::makeGrid(const Boundary &boundary, double cutoff)
00123    {
00124       lengths_ = boundary.lengths();
00125       setCellsAxis(0, cutoff);
00126       setCellsAxis(1, cutoff);
00127       setCellsAxis(2, cutoff);
00128       YZCells_   = numCells_[1]*numCells_[2];
00129       totCells_  = YZCells_*numCells_[0];
00130 
00131       // Postconditions
00132       if (totCells_ < 1) {
00133          UTIL_THROW("totCells_ must be > 1");
00134       }
00135       if (cells_.capacity() > 0 && totCells_ > cells_.capacity()) {
00136          UTIL_THROW("Insufficient cell capacity for this grid");
00137       }
00138 
00139       /*
00140       * Note: No Exception is thrown if cells_.capacity() == 0 in order 
00141       * to allow makeGrid to be used to determine the number of cells 
00142       * to be allocated for a maximum boundary during initialization.
00143       */
00144 
00145       boundaryPtr_ = &boundary;
00146    }
00147 
00148    /*
00149    * Fill an array with Ids of atoms in cell ic and all neighboring cells.
00150    */
00151    void 
00152    CellList::getCellNeighbors(int ic, NeighborArray &neighbors, int &nInCell)
00153    const
00154    {
00155       const Cell *cellPtr;
00156       Atom *atomPtr;
00157       int   icx, icy, icz;
00158       int   jc, jcx, jcy, jcz;
00159       int   dcx, dcy, dcz, jp;
00160 
00161       // Determine cell coordinates icx, icy, icz
00162       cellCoordFromIndex(ic, icx, icy, icz);
00163 
00164       // Zero total number of neighbor atoms and number in cell
00165       //nNeighbor = 0;
00166       nInCell   = 0;
00167       neighbors.clear();
00168 
00169       // Loop over atoms in cell ic.
00170       // By convention, these appear first in the list.
00171       cellPtr = &(cells_[ic]);
00172       for (jp=0; jp < cellPtr->firstClearPos(); ++jp) {
00173          atomPtr = cellPtr->atomPtr(jp);
00174          if (atomPtr != 0) {
00175             neighbors.append(atomPtr);
00176             ++nInCell;
00177          }
00178       }
00179 
00180       // Loop over neighboring cells (excluding cell ic)
00181 
00182       // Loop in x direction
00183       for (dcx = minDel_[0]; dcx <= maxDel_[0]; ++dcx) {
00184          jcx = shiftCellCoordAxis(0, icx + dcx);
00185 
00186          // Loop in y direction
00187          for (dcy = minDel_[1]; dcy <= maxDel_[1]; ++dcy) {
00188             jcy = shiftCellCoordAxis(1, icy + dcy);
00189 
00190             // Loop in z direction
00191             for (dcz = minDel_[2]; dcz <= maxDel_[2]; ++dcz) {
00192                jcz = shiftCellCoordAxis(2, icz + dcz);
00193 
00194                // Get cell index jc and Cell pointer cellPtr
00195                jc = cellIndexFromCoord(jcx, jcy, jcz);
00196 
00197                if (jc != ic) {
00198 
00199                   // Loop over atoms in neighboring cell jc
00200                   cellPtr = &cells_[jc];
00201                   for (jp=0; jp < cellPtr->firstClearPos(); ++jp) {
00202                      atomPtr  = cellPtr->atomPtr(jp);
00203                      if (atomPtr != 0) {
00204                         neighbors.append(atomPtr);
00205                      }
00206                   }
00207 
00208                } // end if (jc != ic)
00209 
00210             } // end for dcz
00211 
00212          } // end for dcy
00213 
00214       } // end for dcx
00215 
00216    } 
00217 
00218    /*
00219    * Get total number of atoms in this CellList.
00220    */
00221    int CellList::nAtom() const
00222    {
00223       int nAtomSum = 0;
00224       for (int icell = 0; icell < totCells_; ++icell) {
00225          nAtomSum += cells_[icell].nAtomCell();
00226       }
00227       return nAtomSum;
00228    }
00229 
00230    /*
00231    * Check validity of CellList, throw an Exception if an error is found.
00232    *
00233    * This method checks consistency of the CellList and Atom data structures.
00234    * Calls Cell::isValid internally for each cell. 
00235    */
00236    bool CellList::isValid(int nAtom) const
00237    {
00238 
00239       // Call Cell::isValid for each Cell. Let any Exceptions bubble up.
00240       int nAtomSum = 0;
00241       for (int icell = 0; icell < totCells_; ++icell) {
00242          cells_[icell].isValid(cellTags_, nAtom, icell);
00243          nAtomSum += cells_[icell].nAtomCell();
00244       }
00245 
00246       // Check that total number of atoms in all cells equals nAtom.
00247       if (nAtom >= 0) {
00248          if (nAtomSum != nAtom) {
00249             UTIL_THROW("Number of atoms in all cells != nAtom");
00250          }
00251       }
00252 
00253       return true;
00254    }
00255
